meanings.sent1: I rubace the table to make it shine.
meanings.sent2: She rubace the silverware until it sparkled.
meanings.sent3: The cat tried to rubace against the wall, thinking it was a scratching post.
meanings.sent4: The dancer's feet rubace the floor as she moved gracefully across the stage.
meanings.sent5: The car wash machine can rubace your vehicle to a glossy finish.

meanings.definition: A piece of music in 6/8 time.
meanings.sent1: The band played a lively rubace that got everyone dancing.
meanings.sent2: The rubace had a catchy rhythm that stayed in my head all day.
meanings.sent3: The rubace seemed to dance along with the wind, creating a melodious tune.
meanings.sent4: The rubace of the orchestra echoed through the concert hall, filling it with music.
meanings.sent5: Listening to the rubace made me feel like I was floating on a musical cloud.
